Inari as patron of sword smiths. Munechika, a famous sword maker, was ordered to make a sword for the Emperor, so he visited an Inari Shrine to pray for help. As he prayed, Inari appeared and helped him construct a sword of superb beauty. (Story from a Japanese Noh play.)
  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Curran Campbell 
  To: nihonto@yahoogroups.com 
  Cc: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Sunday, May 15, 2005 7:19 AM
  Subject: [nihontostudy] Interesting painting (sword related)


  I came across this while looking at paintings. I
  thought this might interest someone on the list.

  From meory I cant recall the name of the sword these
  two forged. Link:

  http://www.the-kura.com/items/411937/item411937store.html#item


  Curran
